symptoms: Symptoms: UAC blocks app installation. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: UAC (User Account Control) Restrictions.
cause: User Account Control blocking elevated actions due to security settings or corrupt UAC configuration.
step_1: Run the installer or app as administrator by right-click → Run as administrator.
step_2: Check UAC slider settings in Control Panel → User Accounts and ensure prompts are enabled.
step_3: If UAC prompts not appearing, restart the Windows Explorer process or reboot.
step_4: Temporarily disable overly restrictive security policies only if safe to do so.
step_5: Re-enable UAC after completing the task to maintain system security.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: UAC blocks app installation - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Problem: Account locked — can't proceed.
symptoms: Symptoms: Account locked. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Credential & Authentication Errors.
cause: Incorrect passwords, domain authentication issues, or Windows Hello configuration problems.
step_1: Ensure you're using the correct username and password; try resetting the password.
step_2: Check Windows Hello settings and reconfigure biometric sign-in if failing.
step_3: If account locked, wait for lockout timer or contact admin for domain accounts.
step_4: Ensure system time is correct as time drift can cause authentication failures.
step_5: If using domain, verify network connectivity to domain controllers and DNS.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: Account locked - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: My PC reports: Defender not turning on — need help.
symptoms: Symptoms: Defender not turning on. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Windows Defender Errors.
cause: Windows Defender services disabled, corrupt definitions, or tamper protection enabled by policy.
step_1: Open Windows Security and check Virus & threat protection status.
step_2: If Defender services are stopped, start them via Services.msc and set to Automatic.
step_3: Check Tamper Protection settings and disable only if necessary for troubleshooting.
step_4: Update virus definitions and run a quick scan to verify protection.
step_5: If Defender fails, use Microsoft Safety Scanner or reinstall via optional features.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: Defender not turning on - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Problem: System unstable due to infection — can't proceed.
symptoms: Symptoms: System unstable due to infection. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Malware & Virus Interference.
cause: Malicious software altering system behavior, injecting processes, or hijacking browsers.
step_1: Disconnect from the internet to limit further malicious activity.
step_2: Boot into Safe Mode and run a full scan with a reputable antivirus and anti-malware tool.
step_3: Use on-demand scanners (Malwarebytes, ESET Online Scanner) to clean infections.
step_4: Restore system to a clean restore point if available after removing malware.
step_5: If infection is severe, backup data and perform a clean OS reinstall.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: System unstable due to infection - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Error: Antivirus blocking app shows up during app install.
symptoms: Symptoms: Antivirus blocking app. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Antivirus / Firewall Blocking Issues.
cause: Security software quarantined or blocked applications; firewall rules blocking traffic.
step_1: Open your antivirus/quarantine panel and check if the app is blocked or quarantined.
step_2: Temporarily allow the app or add it to exclusions if you trust the source.
step_3: Check firewall rules and allow required network access for the app.
step_4: Run a full antivirus scan to ensure no other threats are present.
step_5: If unsure, consult vendor support before disabling protections.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: Antivirus blocking app - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: My PC reports: UAC prompts not appearing — need help.
symptoms: Symptoms: UAC prompts not appearing. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: UAC (User Account Control) Restrictions.
cause: User Account Control blocking elevated actions due to security settings or corrupt UAC configuration.
step_1: Run the installer or app as administrator by right-click → Run as administrator.
step_2: Check UAC slider settings in Control Panel → User Accounts and ensure prompts are enabled.
step_3: If UAC prompts not appearing, restart the Windows Explorer process or reboot.
step_4: Temporarily disable overly restrictive security policies only if safe to do so.
step_5: Re-enable UAC after completing the task to maintain system security.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: UAC prompts not appearing - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Defender failed update appears and blocks my task.
symptoms: Symptoms: Defender failed update. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Windows Defender Errors.
cause: Windows Defender services disabled, corrupt definitions, or tamper protection enabled by policy.
step_1: Open Windows Security and check Virus & threat protection status.
step_2: If Defender services are stopped, start them via Services.msc and set to Automatic.
step_3: Check Tamper Protection settings and disable only if necessary for troubleshooting.
step_4: Update virus definitions and run a quick scan to verify protection.
step_5: If Defender fails, use Microsoft Safety Scanner or reinstall via optional features.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: Defender failed update - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: I keep seeing: File permission restricted when I try to open files.
symptoms: Symptoms: File permission restricted. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Permission & Access Control Errors.
cause: Incorrect NTFS ACLs, ownership mismatch, or file locked by system/service.
step_1: Right-click the file/folder → Properties → Security → Advanced → check Owner.
step_2: If needed, change owner to your account and apply to child objects.
step_3: Grant Full Control permissions to your account and apply changes.
step_4: If file is in use, close apps or use Safe Mode to modify permissions.
step_5: Use `icacls` to reset permissions: `icacls "path" /reset /t` in elevated CMD.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: File permission restricted - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Problem: Protected file deletion blocked — can't proceed.
symptoms: Symptoms: Protected file deletion blocked. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Protected System File Errors.
cause: OS protection prevents modification of critical system files to maintain integrity.
step_1: Run `sfc /scannow` and `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth` to repair protected files.
step_2: If SFC reports protected file issues, review CBS logs and take corrective action.
step_3: Use an elevated command prompt and take ownership only when necessary.
step_4: Avoid disabling system protection permanently; use recovery tools to fix files.
step_5: If required, perform an in-place upgrade repair or clean install after backing up data.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: Protected file deletion blocked - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Problem: Action restricted by system admin — can't proceed.
symptoms: Symptoms: Action restricted by system admin. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Security Policy / Group Policy Restrictions.
cause: Group policy or local security policy prevents certain actions or executable runs.
step_1: Open Local Group Policy Editor (gpedit.msc) and review policies blocking execution.
step_2: If managed by domain, contact your system administrator to adjust necessary policies.
step_3: Use the Resultant Set of Policy (rsop.msc) to review effective policies.
step_4: For script execution, enable appropriate PowerShell execution policy if safe.
step_5: Document policy changes and revert them after troubleshooting if required.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: Action restricted by system admin - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

step_4: Temporarily disable overly restrictive security policies only if safe to do so.
step_5: Re-enable UAC after completing the task to maintain system security.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: UAC prompts not appearing - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Error: Fake antivirus pop-ups shows up during app install.
symptoms: Symptoms: Fake antivirus pop-ups. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Malware & Virus Interference.
cause: Malicious software altering system behavior, injecting processes, or hijacking browsers.
step_1: Disconnect from the internet to limit further malicious activity.
step_2: Boot into Safe Mode and run a full scan with a reputable antivirus and anti-malware tool.
step_3: Use on-demand scanners (Malwarebytes, ESET Online Scanner) to clean infections.
step_4: Restore system to a clean restore point if available after removing malware.
step_5: If infection is severe, backup data and perform a clean OS reinstall.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: Fake antivirus pop-ups - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Error: ACL mismatch shows up during app install.
symptoms: Symptoms: ACL mismatch. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Permission & Access Control Errors.
cause: Incorrect NTFS ACLs, ownership mismatch, or file locked by system/service.
step_1: Right-click the file/folder → Properties → Security → Advanced → check Owner.
step_2: If needed, change owner to your account and apply to child objects.
step_3: Grant Full Control permissions to your account and apply changes.
step_4: If file is in use, close apps or use Safe Mode to modify permissions.
step_5: Use `icacls` to reset permissions: `icacls "path" /reset /t` in elevated CMD.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: ACL mismatch - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Error: SFC/DISM integrity block shows up during app install.
symptoms: Symptoms: SFC/DISM integrity block. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Protected System File Errors.
cause: OS protection prevents modification of critical system files to maintain integrity.
step_1: Run `sfc /scannow` and `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth` to repair protected files.
step_2: If SFC reports protected file issues, review CBS logs and take corrective action.
step_3: Use an elevated command prompt and take ownership only when necessary.
step_4: Avoid disabling system protection permanently; use recovery tools to fix files.
step_5: If required, perform an in-place upgrade repair or clean install after backing up data.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: SFC/DISM integrity block - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: I keep seeing: App quarantined when I try to open files.
symptoms: Symptoms: App quarantined. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Antivirus / Firewall Blocking Issues.
cause: Security software quarantined or blocked applications; firewall rules blocking traffic.
step_1: Open your antivirus/quarantine panel and check if the app is blocked or quarantined.
step_2: Temporarily allow the app or add it to exclusions if you trust the source.
step_3: Check firewall rules and allow required network access for the app.
step_4: Run a full antivirus scan to ensure no other threats are present.
step_5: If unsure, consult vendor support before disabling protections.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: App quarantined - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: I keep seeing: App blocked by UAC when I try to open files.
symptoms: Symptoms: App blocked by UAC. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: UAC (User Account Control) Restrictions.
cause: User Account Control blocking elevated actions due to security settings or corrupt UAC configuration.
step_1: Run the installer or app as administrator by right-click → Run as administrator.
step_2: Check UAC slider settings in Control Panel → User Accounts and ensure prompts are enabled.
step_3: If UAC prompts not appearing, restart the Windows Explorer process or reboot.
step_4: Temporarily disable overly restrictive security policies only if safe to do so.
step_5: Re-enable UAC after completing the task to maintain system security.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: App blocked by UAC - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Tamper protection blocked appears and blocks my task.
symptoms: Symptoms: Tamper protection blocked. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Windows Defender Errors.
cause: Windows Defender services disabled, corrupt definitions, or tamper protection enabled by policy.
step_1: Open Windows Security and check Virus & threat protection status.
step_2: If Defender services are stopped, start them via Services.msc and set to Automatic.
step_3: Check Tamper Protection settings and disable only if necessary for troubleshooting.
step_4: Update virus definitions and run a quick scan to verify protection.
step_5: If Defender fails, use Microsoft Safety Scanner or reinstall via optional features.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: Tamper protection blocked - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: I keep seeing: Wrong credentials when I try to open files.
symptoms: Symptoms: Wrong credentials. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Credential & Authentication Errors.
cause: Incorrect passwords, domain authentication issues, or Windows Hello configuration problems.
step_1: Ensure you're using the correct username and password; try resetting the password.
step_2: Check Windows Hello settings and reconfigure biometric sign-in if failing.
step_3: If account locked, wait for lockout timer or contact admin for domain accounts.
step_4: Ensure system time is correct as time drift can cause authentication failures.
step_5: If using domain, verify network connectivity to domain controllers and DNS.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.

user_error_text: Problem: Group Policy prevents change — can't proceed.
symptoms: Symptoms: Group Policy prevents change. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Security Policy / Group Policy Restrictions.
cause: Group policy or local security policy prevents certain actions or executable runs.
step_1: Open Local Group Policy Editor (gpedit.msc) and review policies blocking execution.
step_2: If managed by domain, contact your system administrator to adjust necessary policies.
step_3: Use the Resultant Set of Policy (rsop.msc) to review effective policies.
step_4: For script execution, enable appropriate PowerShell execution policy if safe.
step_5: Document policy changes and revert them after troubleshooting if required.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: Group Policy prevents change - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Error: Browser hijacker shows up during app install.
symptoms: Symptoms: Browser hijacker. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Malware & Virus Interference.
cause: Malicious software altering system behavior, injecting processes, or hijacking browsers.
step_1: Disconnect from the internet to limit further malicious activity.
step_2: Boot into Safe Mode and run a full scan with a reputable antivirus and anti-malware tool.
step_3: Use on-demand scanners (Malwarebytes, ESET Online Scanner) to clean infections.
step_4: Restore system to a clean restore point if available after removing malware.
step_5: If infection is severe, backup data and perform a clean OS reinstall.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: Browser hijacker - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Error: File permission restricted shows up during app install.
symptoms: Symptoms: File permission restricted. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Permission & Access Control Errors.
cause: Incorrect NTFS ACLs, ownership mismatch, or file locked by system/service.
step_1: Right-click the file/folder → Properties → Security → Advanced → check Owner.
step_2: If needed, change owner to your account and apply to child objects.
step_3: Grant Full Control permissions to your account and apply changes.
step_4: If file is in use, close apps or use Safe Mode to modify permissions.
step_5: Use `icacls` to reset permissions: `icacls "path" /reset /t` in elevated CMD.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: File permission restricted - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Problem: ACL mismatch — can't proceed.
symptoms: Symptoms: ACL mismatch. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Permission & Access Control Errors.
cause: Incorrect NTFS ACLs, ownership mismatch, or file locked by system/service.
step_1: Right-click the file/folder → Properties → Security → Advanced → check Owner.
step_2: If needed, change owner to your account and apply to child objects.
step_3: Grant Full Control permissions to your account and apply changes.
step_4: If file is in use, close apps or use Safe Mode to modify permissions.
step_5: Use `icacls` to reset permissions: `icacls "path" /reset /t` in elevated CMD.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: ACL mismatch - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Error: SFC/DISM integrity block shows up during app install.
symptoms: Symptoms: SFC/DISM integrity block. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Protected System File Errors.
cause: OS protection prevents modification of critical system files to maintain integrity.
step_1: Run `sfc /scannow` and `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth` to repair protected files.
step_2: If SFC reports protected file issues, review CBS logs and take corrective action.
step_3: Use an elevated command prompt and take ownership only when necessary.
step_4: Avoid disabling system protection permanently; use recovery tools to fix files.
step_5: If required, perform an in-place upgrade repair or clean install after backing up data.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: SFC/DISM integrity block - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: I keep seeing: Defender failed update when I try to open files.
symptoms: Symptoms: Defender failed update. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Windows Defender Errors.
cause: Windows Defender services disabled, corrupt definitions, or tamper protection enabled by policy.
step_1: Open Windows Security and check Virus & threat protection status.
step_2: If Defender services are stopped, start them via Services.msc and set to Automatic.
step_3: Check Tamper Protection settings and disable only if necessary for troubleshooting.
step_4: Update virus definitions and run a quick scan to verify protection.
step_5: If Defender fails, use Microsoft Safety Scanner or reinstall via optional features.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: Defender failed update - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: App blocked by UAC appears and blocks my task.
symptoms: Symptoms: App blocked by UAC. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: UAC (User Account Control) Restrictions.
cause: User Account Control blocking elevated actions due to security settings or corrupt UAC configuration.
step_1: Run the installer or app as administrator by right-click → Run as administrator.
step_2: Check UAC slider settings in Control Panel → User Accounts and ensure prompts are enabled.
step_3: If UAC prompts not appearing, restart the Windows Explorer process or reboot.
step_4: Temporarily disable overly restrictive security policies only if safe to do so.
step_5: Re-enable UAC after completing the task to maintain system security.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: App blocked by UAC - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: I keep seeing: Wrong credentials when I try to open files.
symptoms: Symptoms: Wrong credentials. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Credential & Authentication Errors.
cause: Incorrect passwords, domain authentication issues, or Windows Hello configuration problems.
step_1: Ensure you're using the correct username and password; try resetting the password.
step_2: Check Windows Hello settings and reconfigure biometric sign-in if failing.
step_3: If account locked, wait for lockout timer or contact admin for domain accounts.
step_4: Ensure system time is correct as time drift can cause authentication failures.
step_5: If using domain, verify network connectivity to domain controllers and DNS.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.

cause: Group policy or local security policy prevents certain actions or executable runs.
step_1: Open Local Group Policy Editor (gpedit.msc) and review policies blocking execution.

step_4: For script execution, enable appropriate PowerShell execution policy if safe.
step_5: Document policy changes and revert them after troubleshooting if required.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.

step_3: Use an elevated command prompt and take ownership only when necessary.
step_4: Avoid disabling system protection permanently; use recovery tools to fix files.
step_5: If required, perform an in-place upgrade repair or clean install after backing up data.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: System file locked by OS protection - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Action restricted by system admin appears and blocks my task.
symptoms: Symptoms: Action restricted by system admin. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Security Policy / Group Policy Restrictions.
cause: Group policy or local security policy prevents certain actions or executable runs.
step_1: Open Local Group Policy Editor (gpedit.msc) and review policies blocking execution.
step_2: If managed by domain, contact your system administrator to adjust necessary policies.
step_3: Use the Resultant Set of Policy (rsop.msc) to review effective policies.
step_4: For script execution, enable appropriate PowerShell execution policy if safe.
step_5: Document policy changes and revert them after troubleshooting if required.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: Action restricted by system admin - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Problem: Authentication server timeout — can't proceed.
symptoms: Symptoms: Authentication server timeout. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Credential & Authentication Errors.
cause: Incorrect passwords, domain authentication issues, or Windows Hello configuration problems.
step_1: Ensure you're using the correct username and password; try resetting the password.
step_2: Check Windows Hello settings and reconfigure biometric sign-in if failing.
step_3: If account locked, wait for lockout timer or contact admin for domain accounts.
step_4: Ensure system time is correct as time drift can cause authentication failures.
step_5: If using domain, verify network connectivity to domain controllers and DNS.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: Authentication server timeout - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: I keep seeing: Access denied when I try to open files.
symptoms: Symptoms: Access denied. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Permission & Access Control Errors.
cause: Incorrect NTFS ACLs, ownership mismatch, or file locked by system/service.
step_1: Right-click the file/folder → Properties → Security → Advanced → check Owner.
step_2: If needed, change owner to your account and apply to child objects.
step_3: Grant Full Control permissions to your account and apply changes.
step_4: If file is in use, close apps or use Safe Mode to modify permissions.
step_5: Use `icacls` to reset permissions: `icacls "path" /reset /t` in elevated CMD.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: Access denied - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: I keep seeing: Fake antivirus pop-ups when I try to open files.
symptoms: Symptoms: Fake antivirus pop-ups. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Malware & Virus Interference.
cause: Malicious software altering system behavior, injecting processes, or hijacking browsers.
step_1: Disconnect from the internet to limit further malicious activity.
step_2: Boot into Safe Mode and run a full scan with a reputable antivirus and anti-malware tool.
step_3: Use on-demand scanners (Malwarebytes, ESET Online Scanner) to clean infections.
step_4: Restore system to a clean restore point if available after removing malware.
step_5: If infection is severe, backup data and perform a clean OS reinstall.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: Fake antivirus pop-ups - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: App blocked by UAC appears and blocks my task.
symptoms: Symptoms: App blocked by UAC. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: UAC (User Account Control) Restrictions.
cause: User Account Control blocking elevated actions due to security settings or corrupt UAC configuration.
step_1: Run the installer or app as administrator by right-click → Run as administrator.
step_2: Check UAC slider settings in Control Panel → User Accounts and ensure prompts are enabled.
step_3: If UAC prompts not appearing, restart the Windows Explorer process or reboot.
step_4: Temporarily disable overly restrictive security policies only if safe to do so.
step_5: Re-enable UAC after completing the task to maintain system security.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: App blocked by UAC - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Ransomware protection interrupted appears and blocks my task.
symptoms: Symptoms: Ransomware protection interrupted. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Antivirus / Firewall Blocking Issues.
cause: Security software quarantined or blocked applications; firewall rules blocking traffic.
step_1: Open your antivirus/quarantine panel and check if the app is blocked or quarantined.
step_2: Temporarily allow the app or add it to exclusions if you trust the source.
step_3: Check firewall rules and allow required network access for the app.
step_4: Run a full antivirus scan to ensure no other threats are present.
step_5: If unsure, consult vendor support before disabling protections.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.

user_error_text: Problem: Tamper protection blocked — can't proceed.
symptoms: Symptoms: Tamper protection blocked. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Windows Defender Errors.
cause: Windows Defender services disabled, corrupt definitions, or tamper protection enabled by policy.
step_1: Open Windows Security and check Virus & threat protection status.
step_2: If Defender services are stopped, start them via Services.msc and set to Automatic.
step_3: Check Tamper Protection settings and disable only if necessary for troubleshooting.
step_4: Update virus definitions and run a quick scan to verify protection.
step_5: If Defender fails, use Microsoft Safety Scanner or reinstall via optional features.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.

user_error_text: I keep seeing: Access denied when I try to open files.
symptoms: Symptoms: Access denied. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Permission & Access Control Errors.
cause: Incorrect NTFS ACLs, ownership mismatch, or file locked by system/service.
step_1: Right-click the file/folder → Properties → Security → Advanced → check Owner.
step_2: If needed, change owner to your account and apply to child objects.
step_3: Grant Full Control permissions to your account and apply changes.
step_4: If file is in use, close apps or use Safe Mode to modify permissions.
step_5: Use `icacls` to reset permissions: `icacls "path" /reset /t` in elevated CMD.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: Access denied - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Antivirus blocking app appears and blocks my task.
symptoms: Symptoms: Antivirus blocking app. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Antivirus / Firewall Blocking Issues.
cause: Security software quarantined or blocked applications; firewall rules blocking traffic.
step_1: Open your antivirus/quarantine panel and check if the app is blocked or quarantined.
step_2: Temporarily allow the app or add it to exclusions if you trust the source.
step_3: Check firewall rules and allow required network access for the app.
step_4: Run a full antivirus scan to ensure no other threats are present.
step_5: If unsure, consult vendor support before disabling protections.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: Antivirus blocking app - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: My PC reports: Action restricted by system admin — need help.
symptoms: Symptoms: Action restricted by system admin. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Security Policy / Group Policy Restrictions.
cause: Group policy or local security policy prevents certain actions or executable runs.
step_1: Open Local Group Policy Editor (gpedit.msc) and review policies blocking execution.
step_2: If managed by domain, contact your system administrator to adjust necessary policies.
step_3: Use the Resultant Set of Policy (rsop.msc) to review effective policies.
step_4: For script execution, enable appropriate PowerShell execution policy if safe.
step_5: Document policy changes and revert them after troubleshooting if required.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: Action restricted by system admin - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Problem: Windows Hello not working — can't proceed.
symptoms: Symptoms: Windows Hello not working. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Credential & Authentication Errors.
cause: Incorrect passwords, domain authentication issues, or Windows Hello configuration problems.
step_1: Ensure you're using the correct username and password; try resetting the password.
step_2: Check Windows Hello settings and reconfigure biometric sign-in if failing.
step_3: If account locked, wait for lockout timer or contact admin for domain accounts.
step_4: Ensure system time is correct as time drift can cause authentication failures.
step_5: If using domain, verify network connectivity to domain controllers and DNS.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.

user_error_text: Error: UAC blocks app installation shows up during app install.
symptoms: Symptoms: UAC blocks app installation. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: UAC (User Account Control) Restrictions.
cause: User Account Control blocking elevated actions due to security settings or corrupt UAC configuration.
step_1: Run the installer or app as administrator by right-click → Run as administrator.
step_2: Check UAC slider settings in Control Panel → User Accounts and ensure prompts are enabled.
step_3: If UAC prompts not appearing, restart the Windows Explorer process or reboot.
step_4: Temporarily disable overly restrictive security policies only if safe to do so.
step_5: Re-enable UAC after completing the task to maintain system security.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: UAC blocks app installation - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Problem: Protected file deletion blocked — can't proceed.
symptoms: Symptoms: Protected file deletion blocked. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Protected System File Errors.
cause: OS protection prevents modification of critical system files to maintain integrity.
step_1: Run `sfc /scannow` and `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth` to repair protected files.
step_2: If SFC reports protected file issues, review CBS logs and take corrective action.
step_3: Use an elevated command prompt and take ownership only when necessary.
step_4: Avoid disabling system protection permanently; use recovery tools to fix files.
step_5: If required, perform an in-place upgrade repair or clean install after backing up data.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: Protected file deletion blocked - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: I keep seeing: Malware consuming resources when I try to open files.
symptoms: Symptoms: Malware consuming resources. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Malware & Virus Interference.
cause: Malicious software altering system behavior, injecting processes, or hijacking browsers.
step_1: Disconnect from the internet to limit further malicious activity.
step_2: Boot into Safe Mode and run a full scan with a reputable antivirus and anti-malware tool.
step_3: Use on-demand scanners (Malwarebytes, ESET Online Scanner) to clean infections.
step_4: Restore system to a clean restore point if available after removing malware.
step_5: If infection is severe, backup data and perform a clean OS reinstall.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: Malware consuming resources - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

step_2: Check Windows Hello settings and reconfigure biometric sign-in if failing.
step_3: If account locked, wait for lockout timer or contact admin for domain accounts.
step_4: Ensure system time is correct as time drift can cause authentication failures.
step_5: If using domain, verify network connectivity to domain controllers and DNS.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: Wrong credentials - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Problem: Windows Hello not working — can't proceed.
symptoms: Symptoms: Windows Hello not working. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Credential & Authentication Errors.
cause: Incorrect passwords, domain authentication issues, or Windows Hello configuration problems.
step_1: Ensure you're using the correct username and password; try resetting the password.
step_2: Check Windows Hello settings and reconfigure biometric sign-in if failing.
step_3: If account locked, wait for lockout timer or contact admin for domain accounts.
step_4: Ensure system time is correct as time drift can cause authentication failures.
step_5: If using domain, verify network connectivity to domain controllers and DNS.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: Windows Hello not working - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Error: Access denied shows up during app install.
symptoms: Symptoms: Access denied. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Permission & Access Control Errors.
cause: Incorrect NTFS ACLs, ownership mismatch, or file locked by system/service.
step_1: Right-click the file/folder → Properties → Security → Advanced → check Owner.
step_2: If needed, change owner to your account and apply to child objects.
step_3: Grant Full Control permissions to your account and apply changes.
step_4: If file is in use, close apps or use Safe Mode to modify permissions.
step_5: Use `icacls` to reset permissions: `icacls "path" /reset /t` in elevated CMD.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: Access denied - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: My PC reports: Access denied — need help.
symptoms: Symptoms: Access denied. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Permission & Access Control Errors.
cause: Incorrect NTFS ACLs, ownership mismatch, or file locked by system/service.
step_1: Right-click the file/folder → Properties → Security → Advanced → check Owner.
step_2: If needed, change owner to your account and apply to child objects.
step_3: Grant Full Control permissions to your account and apply changes.
step_4: If file is in use, close apps or use Safe Mode to modify permissions.
step_5: Use `icacls` to reset permissions: `icacls "path" /reset /t` in elevated CMD.

user_error_text: My PC reports: Protected file deletion blocked — need help.
symptoms: Symptoms: Protected file deletion blocked. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Protected System File Errors.
cause: OS protection prevents modification of critical system files to maintain integrity.
step_1: Run `sfc /scannow` and `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth` to repair protected files.
step_2: If SFC reports protected file issues, review CBS logs and take corrective action.
step_3: Use an elevated command prompt and take ownership only when necessary.
step_4: Avoid disabling system protection permanently; use recovery tools to fix files.
step_5: If required, perform an in-place upgrade repair or clean install after backing up data.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: Protected file deletion blocked - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Problem: Defender not turning on — can't proceed.
symptoms: Symptoms: Defender not turning on. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Windows Defender Errors.
cause: Windows Defender services disabled, corrupt definitions, or tamper protection enabled by policy.
step_1: Open Windows Security and check Virus & threat protection status.
step_2: If Defender services are stopped, start them via Services.msc and set to Automatic.
step_3: Check Tamper Protection settings and disable only if necessary for troubleshooting.
step_4: Update virus definitions and run a quick scan to verify protection.
step_5: If Defender fails, use Microsoft Safety Scanner or reinstall via optional features.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: Defender not turning on - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Error: Firewall preventing internet access shows up during app install.
symptoms: Symptoms: Firewall preventing internet access. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Antivirus / Firewall Blocking Issues.
cause: Security software quarantined or blocked applications; firewall rules blocking traffic.
step_1: Open your antivirus/quarantine panel and check if the app is blocked or quarantined.
step_2: Temporarily allow the app or add it to exclusions if you trust the source.
step_3: Check firewall rules and allow required network access for the app.
step_4: Run a full antivirus scan to ensure no other threats are present.
step_5: If unsure, consult vendor support before disabling protections.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: Firewall preventing internet access - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Error: Executable blocked by policy shows up during app install.
symptoms: Symptoms: Executable blocked by policy. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Security Policy / Group Policy Restrictions.
cause: Group policy or local security policy prevents certain actions or executable runs.
step_1: Open Local Group Policy Editor (gpedit.msc) and review policies blocking execution.
step_2: If managed by domain, contact your system administrator to adjust necessary policies.
step_3: Use the Resultant Set of Policy (rsop.msc) to review effective policies.
step_4: For script execution, enable appropriate PowerShell execution policy if safe.
step_5: Document policy changes and revert them after troubleshooting if required.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: Executable blocked by policy - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: My PC reports: Browser hijacker — need help.
symptoms: Symptoms: Browser hijacker. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Malware & Virus Interference.
cause: Malicious software altering system behavior, injecting processes, or hijacking browsers.
step_1: Disconnect from the internet to limit further malicious activity.
step_2: Boot into Safe Mode and run a full scan with a reputable antivirus and anti-malware tool.
step_3: Use on-demand scanners (Malwarebytes, ESET Online Scanner) to clean infections.
step_4: Restore system to a clean restore point if available after removing malware.
step_5: If infection is severe, backup data and perform a clean OS reinstall.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: Browser hijacker - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: My PC reports: Firewall preventing internet access — need help.
symptoms: Symptoms: Firewall preventing internet access. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Antivirus / Firewall Blocking Issues.
cause: Security software quarantined or blocked applications; firewall rules blocking traffic.
step_1: Open your antivirus/quarantine panel and check if the app is blocked or quarantined.
step_2: Temporarily allow the app or add it to exclusions if you trust the source.
step_3: Check firewall rules and allow required network access for the app.
step_4: Run a full antivirus scan to ensure no other threats are present.
step_5: If unsure, consult vendor support before disabling protections.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: Firewall preventing internet access - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: I keep seeing: Admin rights required when I try to open files.
symptoms: Symptoms: Admin rights required. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: UAC (User Account Control) Restrictions.
cause: User Account Control blocking elevated actions due to security settings or corrupt UAC configuration.
step_1: Run the installer or app as administrator by right-click → Run as administrator.
step_2: Check UAC slider settings in Control Panel → User Accounts and ensure prompts are enabled.
step_3: If UAC prompts not appearing, restart the Windows Explorer process or reboot.
step_4: Temporarily disable overly restrictive security policies only if safe to do so.
step_5: Re-enable UAC after completing the task to maintain system security.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: Admin rights required - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: Firewall preventing internet access - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Error: App blocked by UAC shows up during app install.
symptoms: Symptoms: App blocked by UAC. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: UAC (User Account Control) Restrictions.
cause: User Account Control blocking elevated actions due to security settings or corrupt UAC configuration.
step_1: Run the installer or app as administrator by right-click → Run as administrator.
step_2: Check UAC slider settings in Control Panel → User Accounts and ensure prompts are enabled.
step_3: If UAC prompts not appearing, restart the Windows Explorer process or reboot.
step_4: Temporarily disable overly restrictive security policies only if safe to do so.
step_5: Re-enable UAC after completing the task to maintain system security.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: App blocked by UAC - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Error: Defender failed update shows up during app install.
symptoms: Symptoms: Defender failed update. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Windows Defender Errors.
cause: Windows Defender services disabled, corrupt definitions, or tamper protection enabled by policy.
step_1: Open Windows Security and check Virus & threat protection status.
step_2: If Defender services are stopped, start them via Services.msc and set to Automatic.
step_3: Check Tamper Protection settings and disable only if necessary for troubleshooting.
step_4: Update virus definitions and run a quick scan to verify protection.
step_5: If Defender fails, use Microsoft Safety Scanner or reinstall via optional features.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: Defender failed update - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: My PC reports: Wrong credentials — need help.
symptoms: Symptoms: Wrong credentials. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Credential & Authentication Errors.
cause: Incorrect passwords, domain authentication issues, or Windows Hello configuration problems.
step_1: Ensure you're using the correct username and password; try resetting the password.
step_2: Check Windows Hello settings and reconfigure biometric sign-in if failing.
step_3: If account locked, wait for lockout timer or contact admin for domain accounts.
step_4: Ensure system time is correct as time drift can cause authentication failures.
step_5: If using domain, verify network connectivity to domain controllers and DNS.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: Wrong credentials - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Problem: UAC blocks app installation — can't proceed.
symptoms: Symptoms: UAC blocks app installation. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: UAC (User Account Control) Restrictions.
cause: User Account Control blocking elevated actions due to security settings or corrupt UAC configuration.
step_1: Run the installer or app as administrator by right-click → Run as administrator.
step_2: Check UAC slider settings in Control Panel → User Accounts and ensure prompts are enabled.
step_3: If UAC prompts not appearing, restart the Windows Explorer process or reboot.
step_4: Temporarily disable overly restrictive security policies only if safe to do so.
step_5: Re-enable UAC after completing the task to maintain system security.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: UAC blocks app installation - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Action restricted by system admin appears and blocks my task.
symptoms: Symptoms: Action restricted by system admin. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Security Policy / Group Policy Restrictions.
cause: Group policy or local security policy prevents certain actions or executable runs.
step_1: Open Local Group Policy Editor (gpedit.msc) and review policies blocking execution.
step_2: If managed by domain, contact your system administrator to adjust necessary policies.
step_3: Use the Resultant Set of Policy (rsop.msc) to review effective policies.
step_4: For script execution, enable appropriate PowerShell execution policy if safe.
step_5: Document policy changes and revert them after troubleshooting if required.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: Action restricted by system admin - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: File permission restricted appears and blocks my task.
symptoms: Symptoms: File permission restricted. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Permission & Access Control Errors.
cause: Incorrect NTFS ACLs, ownership mismatch, or file locked by system/service.
step_1: Right-click the file/folder → Properties → Security → Advanced → check Owner.
step_2: If needed, change owner to your account and apply to child objects.
step_3: Grant Full Control permissions to your account and apply changes.
step_4: If file is in use, close apps or use Safe Mode to modify permissions.
step_5: Use `icacls` to reset permissions: `icacls "path" /reset /t` in elevated CMD.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: File permission restricted - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: I keep seeing: System unstable due to infection when I try to open files.
symptoms: Symptoms: System unstable due to infection. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Malware & Virus Interference.
cause: Malicious software altering system behavior, injecting processes, or hijacking browsers.
step_1: Disconnect from the internet to limit further malicious activity.
step_2: Boot into Safe Mode and run a full scan with a reputable antivirus and anti-malware tool.
step_3: Use on-demand scanners (Malwarebytes, ESET Online Scanner) to clean infections.
step_4: Restore system to a clean restore point if available after removing malware.
step_5: If infection is severe, backup data and perform a clean OS reinstall.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: System unstable due to infection - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: I keep seeing: Script execution disabled when I try to open files.
symptoms: Symptoms: Script execution disabled. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Security Policy / Group Policy Restrictions.
cause: Group policy or local security policy prevents certain actions or executable runs.
step_1: Open Local Group Policy Editor (gpedit.msc) and review policies blocking execution.
step_2: If managed by domain, contact your system administrator to adjust necessary policies.
step_3: Use the Resultant Set of Policy (rsop.msc) to review effective policies.
step_4: For script execution, enable appropriate PowerShell execution policy if safe.
step_5: Document policy changes and revert them after troubleshooting if required.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: Script execution disabled - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: My PC reports: Protected file deletion blocked — need help.
symptoms: Symptoms: Protected file deletion blocked. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Protected System File Errors.
cause: OS protection prevents modification of critical system files to maintain integrity.
step_1: Run `sfc /scannow` and `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth` to repair protected files.
step_2: If SFC reports protected file issues, review CBS logs and take corrective action.
step_3: Use an elevated command prompt and take ownership only when necessary.
step_4: Avoid disabling system protection permanently; use recovery tools to fix files.
step_5: If required, perform an in-place upgrade repair or clean install after backing up data.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: Protected file deletion blocked - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

symptoms: Symptoms: Executable blocked by policy. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Security Policy / Group Policy Restrictions.
cause: Group policy or local security policy prevents certain actions or executable runs.
step_1: Open Local Group Policy Editor (gpedit.msc) and review policies blocking execution.
step_2: If managed by domain, contact your system administrator to adjust necessary policies.
step_3: Use the Resultant Set of Policy (rsop.msc) to review effective policies.
step_4: For script execution, enable appropriate PowerShell execution policy if safe.
step_5: Document policy changes and revert them after troubleshooting if required.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: Executable blocked by policy - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: My PC reports: Protected file deletion blocked — need help.
symptoms: Symptoms: Protected file deletion blocked. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Protected System File Errors.
cause: OS protection prevents modification of critical system files to maintain integrity.
step_1: Run `sfc /scannow` and `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth` to repair protected files.
step_2: If SFC reports protected file issues, review CBS logs and take corrective action.
step_3: Use an elevated command prompt and take ownership only when necessary.
step_4: Avoid disabling system protection permanently; use recovery tools to fix files.
step_5: If required, perform an in-place upgrade repair or clean install after backing up data.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: Protected file deletion blocked - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Problem: Tamper protection blocked — can't proceed.
symptoms: Symptoms: Tamper protection blocked. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Windows Defender Errors.
cause: Windows Defender services disabled, corrupt definitions, or tamper protection enabled by policy.
step_1: Open Windows Security and check Virus & threat protection status.
step_2: If Defender services are stopped, start them via Services.msc and set to Automatic.
step_3: Check Tamper Protection settings and disable only if necessary for troubleshooting.
step_4: Update virus definitions and run a quick scan to verify protection.
step_5: If Defender fails, use Microsoft Safety Scanner or reinstall via optional features.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: Tamper protection blocked - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Error: Browser hijacker shows up during app install.
symptoms: Symptoms: Browser hijacker. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Malware & Virus Interference.
cause: Malicious software altering system behavior, injecting processes, or hijacking browsers.
step_1: Disconnect from the internet to limit further malicious activity.
step_2: Boot into Safe Mode and run a full scan with a reputable antivirus and anti-malware tool.
step_3: Use on-demand scanners (Malwarebytes, ESET Online Scanner) to clean infections.
step_4: Restore system to a clean restore point if available after removing malware.
step_5: If infection is severe, backup data and perform a clean OS reinstall.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: Browser hijacker - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Problem: ACL mismatch — can't proceed.
symptoms: Symptoms: ACL mismatch. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Permission & Access Control Errors.
cause: Incorrect NTFS ACLs, ownership mismatch, or file locked by system/service.
step_1: Right-click the file/folder → Properties → Security → Advanced → check Owner.
step_2: If needed, change owner to your account and apply to child objects.
step_3: Grant Full Control permissions to your account and apply changes.
step_4: If file is in use, close apps or use Safe Mode to modify permissions.
step_5: Use `icacls` to reset permissions: `icacls "path" /reset /t` in elevated CMD.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: ACL mismatch - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: My PC reports: App blocked by UAC — need help.
symptoms: Symptoms: App blocked by UAC. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: UAC (User Account Control) Restrictions.
cause: User Account Control blocking elevated actions due to security settings or corrupt UAC configuration.
step_1: Run the installer or app as administrator by right-click → Run as administrator.
step_2: Check UAC slider settings in Control Panel → User Accounts and ensure prompts are enabled.
step_3: If UAC prompts not appearing, restart the Windows Explorer process or reboot.
step_4: Temporarily disable overly restrictive security policies only if safe to do so.
step_5: Re-enable UAC after completing the task to maintain system security.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: App blocked by UAC - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: I keep seeing: Ransomware protection interrupted when I try to open files.
symptoms: Symptoms: Ransomware protection interrupted. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Antivirus / Firewall Blocking Issues.
cause: Security software quarantined or blocked applications; firewall rules blocking traffic.
step_1: Open your antivirus/quarantine panel and check if the app is blocked or quarantined.
step_2: Temporarily allow the app or add it to exclusions if you trust the source.
step_3: Check firewall rules and allow required network access for the app.
step_4: Run a full antivirus scan to ensure no other threats are present.
step_5: If unsure, consult vendor support before disabling protections.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: Ransomware protection interrupted - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: I keep seeing: Windows Hello not working when I try to open files.
symptoms: Symptoms: Windows Hello not working. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Credential & Authentication Errors.
cause: Incorrect passwords, domain authentication issues, or Windows Hello configuration problems.
step_1: Ensure you're using the correct username and password; try resetting the password.
step_2: Check Windows Hello settings and reconfigure biometric sign-in if failing.
step_3: If account locked, wait for lockout timer or contact admin for domain accounts.
step_4: Ensure system time is correct as time drift can cause authentication failures.
step_5: If using domain, verify network connectivity to domain controllers and DNS.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: Windows Hello not working - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: UAC prompts not appearing appears and blocks my task.
symptoms: Symptoms: UAC prompts not appearing. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: UAC (User Account Control) Restrictions.
cause: User Account Control blocking elevated actions due to security settings or corrupt UAC configuration.
step_1: Run the installer or app as administrator by right-click → Run as administrator.
step_2: Check UAC slider settings in Control Panel → User Accounts and ensure prompts are enabled.
step_3: If UAC prompts not appearing, restart the Windows Explorer process or reboot.
step_4: Temporarily disable overly restrictive security policies only if safe to do so.
step_5: Re-enable UAC after completing the task to maintain system security.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: UAC prompts not appearing - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: I keep seeing: Executable blocked by policy when I try to open files.
symptoms: Symptoms: Executable blocked by policy. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Security Policy / Group Policy Restrictions.
cause: Group policy or local security policy prevents certain actions or executable runs.
step_1: Open Local Group Policy Editor (gpedit.msc) and review policies blocking execution.
step_2: If managed by domain, contact your system administrator to adjust necessary policies.
step_3: Use the Resultant Set of Policy (rsop.msc) to review effective policies.
step_4: For script execution, enable appropriate PowerShell execution policy if safe.
step_5: Document policy changes and revert them after troubleshooting if required.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: Executable blocked by policy - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Error: Antivirus blocking app shows up during app install.
symptoms: Symptoms: Antivirus blocking app. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Antivirus / Firewall Blocking Issues.
cause: Security software quarantined or blocked applications; firewall rules blocking traffic.
step_1: Open your antivirus/quarantine panel and check if the app is blocked or quarantined.
step_2: Temporarily allow the app or add it to exclusions if you trust the source.
step_3: Check firewall rules and allow required network access for the app.
step_4: Run a full antivirus scan to ensure no other threats are present.
step_5: If unsure, consult vendor support before disabling protections.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: Antivirus blocking app - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: My PC reports: Threat services stopped — need help.
symptoms: Symptoms: Threat services stopped. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Windows Defender Errors.
cause: Windows Defender services disabled, corrupt definitions, or tamper protection enabled by policy.
step_1: Open Windows Security and check Virus & threat protection status.
step_2: If Defender services are stopped, start them via Services.msc and set to Automatic.
step_3: Check Tamper Protection settings and disable only if necessary for troubleshooting.
step_4: Update virus definitions and run a quick scan to verify protection.
step_5: If Defender fails, use Microsoft Safety Scanner or reinstall via optional features.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.

symptoms: Symptoms: Authentication server timeout. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Credential & Authentication Errors.
cause: Incorrect passwords, domain authentication issues, or Windows Hello configuration problems.
step_1: Ensure you're using the correct username and password; try resetting the password.

step_4: Ensure system time is correct as time drift can cause authentication failures.
step_5: If using domain, verify network connectivity to domain controllers and DNS.

user_error_text: Access denied appears and blocks my task.
symptoms: Symptoms: Access denied. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Permission & Access Control Errors.
cause: Incorrect NTFS ACLs, ownership mismatch, or file locked by system/service.
step_1: Right-click the file/folder → Properties → Security → Advanced → check Owner.
step_2: If needed, change owner to your account and apply to child objects.
step_3: Grant Full Control permissions to your account and apply changes.
step_4: If file is in use, close apps or use Safe Mode to modify permissions.
step_5: Use `icacls` to reset permissions: `icacls "path" /reset /t` in elevated CMD.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.

cause: Malicious software altering system behavior, injecting processes, or hijacking browsers.

symptoms: Symptoms: Protected file deletion blocked. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Protected System File Errors.
cause: OS protection prevents modification of critical system files to maintain integrity.
step_1: Run `sfc /scannow` and `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth` to repair protected files.
step_2: If SFC reports protected file issues, review CBS logs and take corrective action.
step_3: Use an elevated command prompt and take ownership only when necessary.
step_4: Avoid disabling system protection permanently; use recovery tools to fix files.
step_5: If required, perform an in-place upgrade repair or clean install after backing up data.

step_2: If managed by domain, contact your system administrator to adjust necessary policies.
step_3: Use the Resultant Set of Policy (rsop.msc) to review effective policies.
step_4: For script execution, enable appropriate PowerShell execution policy if safe.
step_5: Document policy changes and revert them after troubleshooting if required.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: Group Policy prevents change - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Fake antivirus pop-ups appears and blocks my task.
symptoms: Symptoms: Fake antivirus pop-ups. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Malware & Virus Interference.
cause: Malicious software altering system behavior, injecting processes, or hijacking browsers.
step_1: Disconnect from the internet to limit further malicious activity.
step_2: Boot into Safe Mode and run a full scan with a reputable antivirus and anti-malware tool.
step_3: Use on-demand scanners (Malwarebytes, ESET Online Scanner) to clean infections.
step_4: Restore system to a clean restore point if available after removing malware.
step_5: If infection is severe, backup data and perform a clean OS reinstall.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: Fake antivirus pop-ups - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Ransomware protection interrupted appears and blocks my task.
symptoms: Symptoms: Ransomware protection interrupted. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Antivirus / Firewall Blocking Issues.
cause: Security software quarantined or blocked applications; firewall rules blocking traffic.
step_1: Open your antivirus/quarantine panel and check if the app is blocked or quarantined.
step_2: Temporarily allow the app or add it to exclusions if you trust the source.
step_3: Check firewall rules and allow required network access for the app.
step_4: Run a full antivirus scan to ensure no other threats are present.
step_5: If unsure, consult vendor support before disabling protections.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: Ransomware protection interrupted - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Problem: Threat services stopped — can't proceed.
symptoms: Symptoms: Threat services stopped. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Windows Defender Errors.
cause: Windows Defender services disabled, corrupt definitions, or tamper protection enabled by policy.
step_1: Open Windows Security and check Virus & threat protection status.
step_2: If Defender services are stopped, start them via Services.msc and set to Automatic.
step_3: Check Tamper Protection settings and disable only if necessary for troubleshooting.
step_4: Update virus definitions and run a quick scan to verify protection.
step_5: If Defender fails, use Microsoft Safety Scanner or reinstall via optional features.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: Threat services stopped - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: I keep seeing: Ownership required when I try to open files.
symptoms: Symptoms: Ownership required. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Permission & Access Control Errors.
cause: Incorrect NTFS ACLs, ownership mismatch, or file locked by system/service.
step_1: Right-click the file/folder → Properties → Security → Advanced → check Owner.
step_2: If needed, change owner to your account and apply to child objects.
step_3: Grant Full Control permissions to your account and apply changes.
step_4: If file is in use, close apps or use Safe Mode to modify permissions.
step_5: Use `icacls` to reset permissions: `icacls "path" /reset /t` in elevated CMD.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: Ownership required - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Error: Windows Hello not working shows up during app install.
symptoms: Symptoms: Windows Hello not working. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Credential & Authentication Errors.
cause: Incorrect passwords, domain authentication issues, or Windows Hello configuration problems.
step_1: Ensure you're using the correct username and password; try resetting the password.
step_2: Check Windows Hello settings and reconfigure biometric sign-in if failing.
step_3: If account locked, wait for lockout timer or contact admin for domain accounts.
step_4: Ensure system time is correct as time drift can cause authentication failures.
step_5: If using domain, verify network connectivity to domain controllers and DNS.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: Windows Hello not working - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: Error: Protected file deletion blocked shows up during app install.
symptoms: Symptoms: Protected file deletion blocked. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Protected System File Errors.
cause: OS protection prevents modification of critical system files to maintain integrity.
step_1: Run `sfc /scannow` and `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth` to repair protected files.
step_2: If SFC reports protected file issues, review CBS logs and take corrective action.
step_3: Use an elevated command prompt and take ownership only when necessary.
step_4: Avoid disabling system protection permanently; use recovery tools to fix files.
step_5: If required, perform an in-place upgrade repair or clean install after backing up data.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: Protected file deletion blocked - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: My PC reports: SFC/DISM integrity block — need help.
symptoms: Symptoms: SFC/DISM integrity block. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Protected System File Errors.
cause: OS protection prevents modification of critical system files to maintain integrity.
step_1: Run `sfc /scannow` and `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth` to repair protected files.
step_2: If SFC reports protected file issues, review CBS logs and take corrective action.
step_3: Use an elevated command prompt and take ownership only when necessary.
step_4: Avoid disabling system protection permanently; use recovery tools to fix files.
step_5: If required, perform an in-place upgrade repair or clean install after backing up data.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: SFC/DISM integrity block - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: ACL mismatch appears and blocks my task.
symptoms: Symptoms: ACL mismatch. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Permission & Access Control Errors.
cause: Incorrect NTFS ACLs, ownership mismatch, or file locked by system/service.
step_1: Right-click the file/folder → Properties → Security → Advanced → check Owner.
step_2: If needed, change owner to your account and apply to child objects.
step_3: Grant Full Control permissions to your account and apply changes.
step_4: If file is in use, close apps or use Safe Mode to modify permissions.
step_5: Use `icacls` to reset permissions: `icacls "path" /reset /t` in elevated CMD.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: ACL mismatch - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: My PC reports: Wrong credentials — need help.
symptoms: Symptoms: Wrong credentials. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Credential & Authentication Errors.
cause: Incorrect passwords, domain authentication issues, or Windows Hello configuration problems.
step_1: Ensure you're using the correct username and password; try resetting the password.
step_2: Check Windows Hello settings and reconfigure biometric sign-in if failing.
step_3: If account locked, wait for lockout timer or contact admin for domain accounts.
step_4: Ensure system time is correct as time drift can cause authentication failures.
step_5: If using domain, verify network connectivity to domain controllers and DNS.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: Wrong credentials - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.

user_error_text: My PC reports: Defender not turning on — need help.
symptoms: Symptoms: Defender not turning on. Operation blocked, prompts appear or services disabled. Category: Windows Defender Errors.
cause: Windows Defender services disabled, corrupt definitions, or tamper protection enabled by policy.
step_1: Open Windows Security and check Virus & threat protection status.
step_2: If Defender services are stopped, start them via Services.msc and set to Automatic.
step_3: Check Tamper Protection settings and disable only if necessary for troubleshooting.
step_4: Update virus definitions and run a quick scan to verify protection.
step_5: If Defender fails, use Microsoft Safety Scanner or reinstall via optional features.
verification: Issue resolved and security services working; no access or permission errors observed.
log_snippet: Defender not turning on - Security event logged in Windows Security / Event Viewer.
